title: f.tol
author: f.tol
content: PLEASE Here is the transaction ID:HASH 6ebd05f7a4520bd1da010ac9d1cd7b1de0e22b7e168780dffb0c5f4c30c3783f PLEASE HELPThanks!

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: I couldn't submit it to ViaBTC accelerator due to the transaction size, but I can see that you're using RBF so you should be able to increase the fees. Which wallet are you using?Also, which service are you sending the funds to? Some services may not process your transaction once you bump its fees.

comments.author: AB de Royse777
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on September 24, 2023, 03:26:25 PMI couldn't submit it to ViaBTC accelerator due to the transaction size, but I can see that you're using RBF so you should be able to bump the fees. Which wallet are you using?I tried too (you are ahead of me LOL) and about to suggest OP to use their paid service.

comments.author: f.tol
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on September 24, 2023, 03:26:25 PMI couldn't submit it to ViaBTC accelerator due to the transaction size, but I can see that you're using RBF so you should be able to increase the fees. Which wallet are you using?Also, which service are you sending the funds to? Some services may not process your transaction once you bump its fees.THE SENDER REFUSE EDIT FEES IAM THE RECIPIENT

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.created_time: September 24, 2023, 03:31:37 PMLast edit: September 24, 2023, 03:42:06 PM by Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: f.tol on September 24, 2023, 03:30:33 PMTHE SENDER REFUSE EDIT FEES IAM THE RECIPIENTYou have to tell the sender to pump the fee. If he is not answering you, you can use child-pay-for-parent to pump the fee on wallets like Electrum or Bluewallet. If you use child-pay-for-parent to pump the fee, use 26 sat/vbyte.By using child-pay-for-parent, you will send part or all the coin in the unconfirmed transaction to another address on your wallet. Before a miner can include your transaction (child transaction) into a block, the miner has to include the parent transaction (this unconfirmed transaction) into a block, but the fee you will pay for your transaction should be enough to get two transactions confirmed, this will make a miner to include both transactions into the same block early.

comments.author: f.tol
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on September 24, 2023, 03:31:37 PMQuote from: f.tol on September 24, 2023, 03:30:33 PMTHE SENDER REFUSE EDIT FEES IAM THE RECIPIENTYou have to tell the sender to pump the fee. If he is not answering you, you can use child-pay-for-parent to pump the fee on wallets like Electrum or Bluewallet. If you use child-pay-for-parent to pump the fee, use 26 sat/vbyte.By using child-pay-for-parent, you will send part or all the unconfirmed transaction to another address on your wallet. Before a miner can include your transaction (child transaction ) into a block, the miner has to include the parent transaction (this unconfirmed transaction) into a block as well, but the fee you paid for your transaction which is enough to get two transactions confirmed will make a miner to include both transaction into the same block early.HOW I USE THIS IAM NOT SENDER IAM THE RECIPIENT AND I RECIVE THIS PAYMENT TO HITBTC

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: f.tol on September 24, 2023, 03:37:47 PMHOW I USE THIS IAM NOT SENDER IAM THE RECIPIENT AND I RECIVE THIS PAYMENT TO HITBTC You do not have the private key. You have no option than to tell the sender to pump the fee. Do not accept unconfirmed transaction.

comments.author: f.tol
comments.body: if i wait how much day you think its take and no miner here can take money and confirm it

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on September 24, 2023, 03:26:25 PMI couldn't submit it to ViaBTC accelerator due to the transaction size, Even if the transaction size was 500 bytes or less, it would still be impossible to submit it to ViaBTC free accelerator.To submit a transaction to ViaBTC free accelerator, it must have the free rate of at least 10 sat/byte. The transaction in question has been made with the fee rate of only 4.98 sat/byte.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: f.tol on September 24, 2023, 03:46:59 PM if i wait how much day you think its take and no miner here can take money and confirm it After 14 days, most nodes would have dropped the transaction from their mempool and the sender will be able to rebroadcast the transaction again, but which can be to another address if he wants.Mempool has not be less congested lately to the extent that transaction of 10 sat/vbyte are getting confirmed. The least seen recently is 14 sat/vbyte. You can wait because maybe the mempool can become less congested, but the probability that the transaction will be confirmed is very low. Do not accept the transaction until it is confirmed. And always tell him to pump the fee.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Quote from: f.tol on September 24, 2023, 03:46:59 PM-snip-and no miner here can take money and confirm it Well, ViaBTC does have a paid service, I just tried it on your transaction. It would cost you ~120 USD. I don't see why you would want to pay that for the amount you're transacting though, you're better off waiting.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on September 24, 2023, 04:05:36 PMWell, ViaBTC does have a paid service, I just tried it on your transaction. It would cost you ~120 USD. I don't see why you would want to pay that for the amount you're transacting though, you're better off waiting.Binance pool is cheaper than ViaBTC, but not also advisable because it is still too high. He will pay $67 if it is Binance pool. But, provided if he is a Binance user.But generally, paid accelerators are not advisable to be used due to the high fee needed.But because the transaction is supporting replace-by-fee, I think the best option is to convince the sender to increase the fee.

comments.author: Findingnemo
comments.body: Quote from: f.tol on September 24, 2023, 03:46:59 PM if i wait how much day you think its take and no miner here can take money and confirm it As said 14 days is the time period when most nodes will drop your TX from mempool and its already 1 week since the TX broadcasted now you may have to wait for one more week to see the transaction disappear from your exchange wallet.So the user has to send the amount back to you with a higher fee if you don't want to get into the same situation.Paying a miner for $350 worth of TX is most likely not possible, it can be done but you need to find a miner to do that which is unlikely possible in 2023 even in bitcointalk.I am not sure this transacted amount is for a payment or something but as others said don't accept this as payment until you see at least one confirmation.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: f.tol on September 24, 2023, 03:46:59 PM if i wait how much day you think its take and no miner here can take money and confirm it No miners here on the forum can do that because most of them are mining on the pool so they can't able to include your transaction to confirm.About your transaction, we do not know when will this transaction be confirmed it defends on the network.It seems today the lowest fee from previously mined blocks is 12sat/byte. You can wait until next week since the transaction was created a week ago.After this week if the transaction is still unconfirmed you should contact the sender because it will automatically rejected by the nodes and tell him to use the fee recommended by mempool.space.
